global.closeAndDoNotShowAgain: Close and do not show again

maps.updateSearchAfterZoomOrCenterChange: Update search after zoom or center change
maps.pageNotFound: Page not not found. Check if the URL is not malformed

about.donateText: Please donate your geographic data to
about.info_I: Openrouteservice is being developed and provided by Heidelberg Institute for Geoinformation Technology (HeiGIT) and offers Routing services by using user-generated, collaboratively collected free geographic data from OpenStreetMap. Please donate your geographic data to openstreetmap.org!
about.info_II: We use the browser's local storage to preserve information so you will not have to re-enter it during your visit or in subsequent visits. We do not collect or store any personal information about you or personally identifiable information about you, except what you voluntarily provide through direct contact. Furthermore, we do not share analytic data with any service providers or partners.
about.sources: We use different open source libraries for this web application. These can be found within the corresponding package files on
about.feelFreeToReportBugs: Please feel free to report bugs on
about.orToFixThem: or fix them by yourself and make a pull request
about.info_III: Users are prohibited from any commercial, non-free resale, or redistribution without explicit written permission from CIAT. Original data by Jarvis A., H.I. Reuter, A. Nelson, E. Guevara, 2008, Hole-filled seamless SRTM data V4, International Centre for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT)
about.info_IV: In case you have any further questions, concerns or feedback, please contact us via:
about.info_V: Openrouteservice cares about your inquiries, problems, questions etc. As there will always be a stream of inquiries, we take strong responsibility to respond to you in short time. After you have received our automatic response email to let you know we have received your inquiry, we will usually respond shortly. Please give us time to look into your reported issue properly before getting back.
about.supportText: Openrouteservice offers free services and relies on donations for a majority of its funding. If you would like to support the further development of features and server infrastructure donations are very welcome.

formFields.wrongInputValue: Wrong input value for this parameter.

download.fileTooBigToBeDownloaded: File too big to be downloaded

isochrones.itWasNotPossibleToCalculateIsochronesWit: It was not possible to calculate isochrones with the defined options. Try to define smaller isochrone(s).
isochrones.couldResolveTheSelectedPlaceAsASuitableC: It was not possible to resolve the selected point as a suitable center.

apiError.2003: The area of a polygon to avoid must not exceed 20.0000 square kilometers.
apiError.3001: One or more parameters have an incorrect value or format.
apiError.3004: The combination of profile, interval and time or distance selected exceeds the maximum supported. Please adjust the values.
apiError.3099: Unable to build an isochrone map for the selected point(s) and profile.

isochrones.genericErrorMsg: It was not possible to calculate the isochrones.

routeExtras.clickToHighlightOnMap: Click to highlight it on map

warningCodes.1: There may be restrictions on some roads
warningCodes.2: There are tollways along the route
warningCodes.3: There are skipped segments along the route. Durations and accessibility may not be correct
warningCodes.4: At least one extra info requested but it is not available

placesAndDirections.notRouteFound: It was not possible to find a route connecting the places with the selected profile
placesAndDirections.notRouteFoundWithFilters: It was not possible to find a route connecting the places with the selected profile and filters
placesAndDirections.noPlaceFound: No place found with the inputted content
placesAndDirections.orderByClosestPlaces: Order by places closer to your location
placesAndDirections.errorRenderingContentUploaded: Error while rendering the content uploaded. Check the file format and content
placesAndDirections.notPossibleToCalculateRoute: A route could not be calculated using one of the selected places

apiError.2003: Route parameters exceed one or more limits. Please remember that some avoidables have limits, like the route length and the area of an avoid polygon that must not exceed 20000 square kilometers.
apiError.2004: Route parameters exceed one or more limits. Remember that the approximated route distance must not be greater than 6000 kms. When certain route options or avoidables are used, the approximated route distance must not be greater than 150 kms.
apiError.2006: Unable to parse the request to the export handler
apiError.2009: Unable to find a suitable route for the places and criteria specified. Maybe the profile specified is not supported in this area/region with the filter(s) applied.
apiError.2010: It was not possible to find a suitable point that is part of the route. Maybe one of the points selected is not routable or the selected profile is not supported in this region
apiError.2011: When using alternative routes option it is not possible to define route stops
apiError.2012: An invalid parameter was specified. Make sure the URL is correct
apiError.2099: Unable to compute a route connecting connecting the places selected

placesAndDirections.genericErrorMsg: It was not possible to calculate the route

acquirePositionErrors.generic: It was not possible to acquire your location because it was not authorized or the device does not support it.
acquirePositionErrors.unavailable: According to your device your location is currently not available. Make sure the positioning option/service is properly configured.
acquirePositionErrors.permissionDenied: Your position could not be acquired because the device denied access to it. You can retry it by changing the device settings and then click again on the "my position button"
acquirePositionErrors.timeout: Your device returned "timeout" while trying to acquire a position. You can retry it by clicking on the "my position button"

topMenu.settingsTooltip: Click here if you want to adjust app settings

preference.label: Route preference
preference.description: The preferred factor to be considered when calculating routes

range_type.label: Isochrone method
range_type.description: Method used to calculate the isochrone

time_range.label: Range
time_range.description: The max range of the isochrones to be calculated

distance_range.label: Range
distance_range.description: The max range of the isochrones to be calculated

time_interval.label: Interval
time_interval.description: The interval of the isochrones to be calculated

distance_interval.label: Interval
distance_interval.description: The interval of the isochrones to be calculated

axleload.label: Axle load
axleload.description: The maximum axle load in tons

height.label: Height
height.description: The maximum height in meters. The limits are not enforced by the server and are just there to make sure no unreasonable values are set. Any weirdly large values might lead to unusable routes when OpenStreetMap database isn't tagged enough for this.

length.label: Length
length.description: The maximum length in meters. The limits are not enforced by the server and are just there to make sure no unreasonable values are set. Any weirdly large values might lead to unusable routes when OpenStreetMap database isn't tagged enough for this.

width.label: Width
width.description: The maximum width in meters. The limits are not enforced by the server and are just there to make sure no unreasonable values are set. Any weirdly large values might lead to unusable routes when OpenStreetMap database isn't tagged enough for this.

maximum_sloped_kerb.label: Max kerb height
maximum_sloped_kerb.description: Specifies the maximum height of the sloped curb in meters

minimum_width.label: Footway minimum width
minimum_width.description: Specifies the minimum width of the footway in metres

smoothness_type.label: Route smoothness
smoothness_type.description: Specifies the minimum smoothness of the route. Further infos: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:smoothness

surface_type.label: Min. surface type
surface_type.description: Specifies the minimum surface type. Type order: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:surface

track_type.label: Minimum route grade
track_type.description: Specifies the minimum grade of the route. Grade values: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:tracktype

round_trip_length.label: Length of the round trip
round_trip_length.description: The target length of the route (note that this is a preferred value, but results may be different).

points.label: Points
points.description: The number of points to use on the route. Larger values create more circular routes.

seed.label: Random seed
seed.description: A random seed to use for adding randomisation to the generated route (min:0, max: 90)

target_count.label: Number of routes
target_count.description: Target number of alternative routes to compute. Service returns up to this number of routes that fulfill the share-factor and weight-factor constraints.

share_factor.label: Share factor
share_factor.description: Maximum fraction of the route that alternatives may share with the optimal route. The default value of 0.6 means alternatives can share up to 60% of path segments with the optimal route.

weight_factor.label: Weight factor
weight_factor.description: Maximum factor by which route weight may diverge from the optimal route. The default value of 1.4 means alternatives can be up to 1.4 times longer (costly) than the optimal route.

maximum_speed.label: Maximum speed
maximum_speed.description: The maximum speed that must be applied

green.label: Green (Germany only)
green.description: Prefer green areas (only available for Germany)

quiet.label: Quiet (Germany only)
quiet.description: Prefer quiet areas (only available for Germany)

surface_quality_known.label: Only surfaces with known quality
surface_quality_known.description: Forces the usage only of edges where the surface quality is explicitly known

allow_unsuitable.label: Allow unsuitable
allow_unsuitable.description: Allows usage of edges that might be unsuitable for wheelchair which were formerly excluded

vehicle_type.label: Vehicle type
vehicle_type.description: Vehicle type to be considered for the route calculation
